snippet: The 81-year-old Power and Light Building in Kansas City is no longer viable as office space, but some developers say it has potential as apartments or a hotel.
abstract: Developers in Kansas City, Mo, say that the 81-year-old Art Deco Power and Light Building has potential as apartments or a hotel, but is no longer viable as office space; Gailoyd Enterprises Corporation put the 230,000-square-foot building up for sale in March for $17.5 million; whether a new owner can provide the hefty investment needed for a major conversion is far from certain.
lead_paragraph: The 81-year-old Power and Light Building in Kansas City is no longer viable as office space, but some developers say it has potential as apartments or a hotel.

headline.seo: Kansas City’s Power and Light Building Awaits New Role
